node.title: Focus on Politics: A border breakthrough
node.description: This week, Deputy Political Editor Craig McCulloch recounts the siege of Fortress New Zealand, and reckons with its reconnection to the world. Audio
node.content:
["Fortress New Zealand - the 'hermit kingdom'\u00a0-\u00a0is soon to be no more.", "For almost two years, Aotearoa has been cut off - foreigners for the most part have been barred entry, with returning New Zealanders having to complete a stay in government-run managed isolation and quarantine (MIQ).", "Limited capacity has at times made it near impossible for some New Zealanders to come home, eventually leading to the online lottery system.", "That situation was brought into stark relief this week by Charlotte Bellis, a pregnant Kiwi journalist\u00a0stuck in Afghanistan, who published an open letter in the Weekend Herald\u00a0detailing her struggle to return home.\u00a0", "", "
\nGraphic: RNZ / Vinay Ranchhod\n
", "The extreme border\u00a0measures have undoubtedly saved lives and\u00a0secured\u00a0New Zealand's relative freedom from the virus.", "But they have also curtailed\u00a0the freedoms of those wanting to come here\u00a0and caused tremendous heartbreak for families cut off\u00a0and citizens stranded.", "As epidemiologist Michael Baker acknowledged, with Omicron expected to spread widely within the country, the hard border would become\u00a0harder\u00a0to justify.", "\"Once we get to the point of having thousands of Omicron cases a day in New Zealand, MIQ's role is very different,\" Prof Baker says.", "Read more:", "Ministers swiftly moved into clean-up mode.\u00a0On Tuesday,\u00a0Cabinet met to discuss its\u00a0timeline for phasing out MIQ.\u00a0", "On Wednesday, booster dose eligibility was expanded to an extra million New Zealanders by shortening the interval after the second dose.\u00a0", "And on Thursday, Ardern delivered a speech in Auckland detailing the five-stage reopening plan:\u00a0", "\"I know while many will celebrate today\u2019s reopening, others will feel anxious about the resumption of people across our border,\" Ardern told New Zealanders.", "\"But here are the safeguards: we will be as boosted as possible at the end of February, the phasing reduces the risk of a surge in cases, and travellers will be testing and isolating, with MIQ remaining for the unvaccinated.\"", "Her talk of balance, of a managed approach,\u00a0reveals the\u00a0tension behind the plan. Closed borders have given many New Zealanders a feeling of\u00a0security, but\u00a0some - like ACT's\u00a0David Seymour - call it\u00a0too cautious.\u00a0", "Many businesses welcome\u00a0the overall change in strategy,\u00a0but want it to go further. Flight Centre\u00a0managing director David Coombes fears seven to 10 days of isolating will\u00a0put off potential visitors.", "For now, Ardern and her ministers have\u00a0been careful to hedge their bets, noting the situation will change as time goes on. Widespread Omicron could yet mean the need for self-isolation will evaporate before too long.", "Ardern has been\u00a0clear: reconnection\u00a0does not mean a return to life before Covid-19, and the coming weeks are likely to bring a tidal wave of cases across the country.", "There's a certain irony that\u00a0Omicron's evasion of\u00a0the country's border protections has made it easier to reconnect with the world.\u00a0Unfortunately, it comes with a cost and one New Zealanders have yet to see.", "In today's\u00a0Focus on Politics\u00a0podcast, Deputy Political Editor Craig McCulloch recounts the siege of Fortress New Zealand and reckons with its reconnection to the world.\u00a0", "Listen free to\u00a0Focus on Politics\u00a0on\u00a0Apple Podcasts, on\u00a0\u00a0Spotify, on\u00a0iHeart Radio\u00a0or wherever you get your podcasts.\u00a0"]
